snippet: The wide coverage of Beijing’s air, which has been rated “hazardous” or even worse since last week, was the most open display of coverage on the issue in recent memory.
abstract: Chinese state news media publishes aggressive reports on what they describe as sickening and dangerous air pollution in Beijing and other parts of northern China, indicating that popular anger over air quality has reached level where propaganda officials feel they have to allow officially sanctioned press to address growing concerns of ordinary citizens.
lead_paragraph: The wide coverage of Beijing’s air, which has been rated “hazardous” or even worse since last week, was the most open display of coverage on the issue in recent memory.
